title: CORSO ONLINE INFELTRIMENTO: ALBERO
time: DEC 4 AT 7:30 PM UTC+01 – DEC 9 AT 7:30 PM UTC+01
description:
Continuiamo con i corsi online di infeltrimento e questa volta andiamo su un progetto un po' più complesso: albero con cannella ( 50 cm di magia )
Il corso sarà online, perciò potrete partecipare da tutta Italia, comodamente a casa vostra e sarà diviso su due serate:
venerdì 4 dicembre dalle 19.30
e mercoledì 9 dicembre dalle 19.30
[ sarà indispensabile partecipare ad entrambe le serate ]
nella quota di 25 € è compreso:
- corso di due sere
- kit del colore preferito
- un ago
Oltre al kit sarà necessario avere:
- spugna come base di lavoro
- aghi in più ( è facile romperli)
- imbottitura
- ago e filo per cuciture a mano
- colla a caldo
[ il materiale che vi manca può esservi spedito insieme al kit ]
Spedizioni in tutta Italia tramite corriere
Info e ordini tramite messaggio whatsapp 348.0530502

title: Your Skills And Jobs Online Week
time: NOV 30 AT 1 PM UTC+01 – DEC 4 AT 3 PM UTC+01
description:
At a time when the digital and green transitions are rapidly changing the way we work, the European Commission’s Directorate-General for Employment, Social Affairs and Inclusion (DG EMPL) is happy to present a unique online Open Week on ‘Your Skills and Jobs’, with different activities organised in digital format from 30 November to 4 December!
Find out what the EU is doing to help you find jobs and manage your career
For 5 days - whether you are a student, a young person looking for a first job, an experienced worker or an entrepreneur -, you will get a chance to share experience and receive advice from experts on drafting your CV, on job and apprenticeships opportunities, on skills, and much more
13 live chats with job experts
2 quizzes on your green & digital skills
A unique opportunity to WIN a 1-hour personal counselling session with a career guidance practitioner from the Euroguidance network (www.euroguidance.eu)
Find out more on the programme below and pick your sessions NOW!
To keep up-to-date with all ‘Your Skills And Jobs’ announcements, follow this event!
#YourSkillsAndJobs
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Live Chats Programme
Monday 30 November
1:00 - 1:30 PM: Eurowhat? Europass, the tool to manage your career in Europe! Europass demonstration – Session in Portuguese
Europass is the tool to manage your career in Europe! Create your CV, job applications, manage your credentials, get suggestions for training and job vacancies that fit your profile and more!
In this demonstration, a Europass expert will show the main features of the tool and explain how to use it to get jobs and manage your career.
Speaker:
Pedro Chaves, Europass Project Officer, European Commission
Moderator:
Pedro Amorim, Policy Officer, European Commission
In the meantime, watch this short clip and discover 5 reasons why you should use Europass
https://bit.ly/Europass5
And listen to Danay explain how Europass has benefitted him
https://bit.ly/EuropassDanay
More info on Europass
https://europa.eu/europass/en

2:00 - 2:45 PM: Youth Guarantee your path to employment! – Session in French
The Youth Guarantee is your path to employment! Are you under 29 and looking for a job or a training opportunity? The Youth Guarantee is a commitment by all Member States to ensure that all young people receive a good quality offer of:
• employment
• continued education
• apprenticeship
• traineeship
More particularly, within a period of 4 months of becoming unemployed or leaving formal education. In this live chat, a job coach will explain how she is helping young people to find jobs.
Speakers:
Caroline Ravaux, Job Coach, Actiris
Moderator:
Mathilde Grosjean, Communication Officer, European Commission
Curious about the Youth Guarantee programme? Listen to Theodora’s experience
https://bit.ly/YouthGuarant
More info on the Youth Guarantee
https://bit.ly/YouthGuarant1


Tuesday 1 December
12.00 - 12:30 PM: Entrepreneurship, is this something for you? – Session in Greek
Have you ever thought of creating your own company? Would you like inspiration on different ways to do it?
A young entrepreneur will share his experience and reply to the audience’s questions.
Speaker:
Stefanos Alexopoulos, Benelux Owner and Head of International Department, Coco-MAT.bike
Moderator, Dimitrios Pikios, Policy Officer, European Commission

1:00 - 1:45 PM: How social is the European Social Fund? – Session in French
The European Social Fund (ESF) was created in the founding Treaty of Rome in 1957. With EUR 10 billion a year, the ESF supports employment, improved education and better chances for all. In this session, our experts will discuss with the audience about how the ESF is helping people and creating a more inclusive society in the EU.
Speakers:
Benjamin Fontaine, ESF Programme Manager, European Commission
Isabelle Maquet, Deputy Head of Unit, European Commission
Moderator:
Mathilde Grosjean, Communication Officer, European Commission
Keen on knowing more about it? Watch this short clip & discover what the European Social Fund is
https://bit.ly/EUSocialFund
More info on the European Social Fund
https://ec.europa.eu/esf/home.jsp

2:30 - 3:00 PM: Eurowhat? Europass, the tool to manage your career in Europe! Europass demonstration – Session in Croatian
Europass is the tool to manage your career in Europe! Create your CV, job applications, manage your credentials, get suggestions for training and job vacancies that fit your profile and more! In this demonstration, a Europass expert will show the main features of the tool and explain how to use it to get jobs and manage your career.
Speakers:
Hrvoje Grganović, Europass Project Officer, European Commission
Moderator: Mia Trcol, Project Manager, Euroguidance Croatia
Interested in this session? Watch this short clip and discover 5 reasons why you should use Europass
https://bit.ly/Europass5
And listen to Danay explain how Europass has benefitted him
https://bit.ly/EuropassDanay
More info on Europass
https://europa.eu/europass/en


Wednesday 2 December
12.30 - 1:00 PM: The EU Skills Agenda explained– Session in English
Skills, skills and more skills: your key to success! Find out how the EU is helping people acquire new skills and find their way in the labour market. In this live chat, a Commission expert will explain the New Skills Agenda: a five-year plan for competitiveness, social fairness and resilience that will help shape the labour market in the EU.
Speaker:
Alison Crabb, Head of Unit, European Commission
Moderator:
Jennifer Baker, EU policy and Tech Journalist
Want to know more on the European Skills Agenda? Watch this short video
https://bit.ly/SkillsAgenda1
More info on EU Skills Agenda
https://bit.ly/SkillsAgenda2

1:30 - 2:00 PM: Eurowhat? Europass, the tool to manage your career in Europe! Europass demonstration – Session in German
Europass is the tool to manage your career in Europe! Create your CV, job applications, manage your credentials, get suggestions for training and job vacancies that fit your profile and more! 2:30 - 3:00 PM: Apprenticeships, from learning to working – Session in German
There are more ways to get a job than a university degree. Find out how apprenticeships can help you get the skills and experience you need to access the labour market. Our speaker will share his personal experience as an apprentice.
Speaker:
Mattäus Fandrejewski, Youth representative, European Confederation of Independent Trade Unions
Moderator:
Karin Kammerling, Communication Trainee, European Commission
Discover how apprenticeships can benefit society by watching this video
https://bit.ly/EuApprent
And listen to Saskia and Rafael’s story on their apprenticeships:
https://bit.ly/EUApprent1
https://bit.ly/EUApprent2

1:30-2:15 PM: How EaSI is it to find a job? Talk to the experts– Session in English
Are you interested in working in another EU country? Is social entrepreneurship something for you? Have you heard about microfinance opportunities? Find out with our experts how the EU programme for Employment and Social Innovation (EaSI) is boosting employment and creating fair conditions for all in the labour market.
Speakers:
Henk Visser, EaSI Programme Coordinator, European Commission
Sarah O’Brien, Cross-border Coordinator, EURES Scheldemond
Martin Rijk, Advisor, EURES
Amira Bieber, Pro Arbeit-Kreis Offenbach

2:00 - 2:45 PM: “Your skills and jobs” Closing Panel Debate – Session in English
Last chance to discuss jobs and skills with our experts! Don’t miss out on the closing debate of “Your skills and jobs”! Some experts that were present during the week will share their thoughts on challenges and opportunities of the labour market.

hosts:
Host
Regional English Language Office Belgrade
Government Organization
title: 4-day Course for English Teachers "Supporting Emerging Writers"
time: DEC 1 AT 5 PM UTC+01 – DEC 4 AT 6 PM UTC+01
description:
The course will consist of four, live, one-hour webinars and aims to provide teachers with more confidence in integrating writing instruction into online and blended learning environments.
Writing is a powerful tool for self-reflection and purposeful communication, often associated with solitude. Developing this skill, however, requires collaboration and constructive feedback. Through four hands-on workshops, we will investigate strategies to support English writing development in online learning environments for all proficiency levels and age groups.
Beyond receiving new ideas, teachers will gain the experience of brainstorming, problem solving, and evaluating instructional methods with peer educators, leaving the sessions with greater confidence in your own resourcefulness and membership in a community of practice.
Dates: December 1 - 4, 2020
Time: 17:00 - 18:00 GMT+1
Short bio of the EL Specialist:
Thaddeus McCleary is an Instructor at Fort Hays State University (Kansas, USA), where he teaches composition and English language proficiency courses through partnerships with universities in China. He was an English Language Fellow in Ukraine from 2015 - 2017 and previously taught at public institutions in the USA and South Korea. Along with a Master of Education degree in TESOL, he recently completed an Educational Specialist degree program from the University of Missouri during which he designed and developed software for education.
Certificate
Teachers who participate in all four one-hour webinars will have access to a self-sign e-certificate, to which they can add their names and self-certify their participation.
How to Register
Please use the following link to register for the course:
https://statedept.zoomgov.com/.../vJIscOGvrTwjGjz4I5ZnK...
After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the meeting.
If you have further questions, contact belgraderelo@state.gov or visit
https://www.facebook.com/RELOBelgrade/

title: European Documentary Day
time: NOV 29 AT 4:30 PM UTC+01 – DEC 3 AT 5:30 PM UTC+01
description: The Human Rights Film Forum 2020 offered us diverse perspectives on storytelling. The feedback of the community was simply amazing. We want to continue our efforts through smaller events throughout the year and are excited to announce the first event on November 29, 2020: With support of the Berliner Senatskanzlei we are more than happy to host two panel discussions on the Future of European Documentaries and intimate expert talks giving you a deeper understanding of impact producing, audience development or media politics in the following week.

hosts:
Host
WSA
Nonprofit Organization
title: WSA European Young Innovators Festival Graz
time: NOV 30 AT 9 AM UTC+01 – DEC 2 AT 6:30 PM UTC+01
description:
You are interested in sustainable solutions?
Social entrepreneurship is your thing?
You want to really connect with a new and fresh community of lateral thinkers?
Make sure to join and contribute to the European Young Innovators Festival in Graz.
The European Young Innovators Festival brings together the pan-European community of young innovators who use digital technology to achieve the UN SDGs.
With the regional initiative of the European Young Innovators (EYI), WSA connects and highlights purpose driven digital entrepreneurship across Europe.
Since many years, Graz is hosting the Festival – the perfect festival location with its universities, the green tech cluster, as city of human rights and city of design - turning into a hub for social innovation, entrepreneurship and European youth exchange.
This year, Graz is the starting point of a virtual journey across Europe. The EYI Festival will offer a truly unique insight into young entrepreneurship from all over Europe, the latest digital trends and international perspectives on innovation.
The Festival program offers the pitches of the European Young Innovators in front of an international jury, knowledge and mentoring sessions and an interactive workshop program.
International speakers will discuss how digital entrepreneurs can help to tackle the global pandemic, the economic crises and other societal challenges of Europe - Climate change, the future of Social Entrepreneurship, and Gaming for Good are only some of the highlights that will be discussed.
This Festival will not be the usual online happening, you will connect in interactive workshops, One on One meetings and Ask me Anything sessions – register now and join the journey towards the future of the Europe that we want.
Digital. Purpose Driven. European.

hosts:
Hosts
Frances Stanfield
Artist
London Drawing Group
Education
title: HENRI MATISSE ONLINE: Painting with Scissors
time: DEC 5 AT 3 PM UTC+01 – 4 PM UTC+01
description:
We've got an incredible number of you interested in this online class but we can only host a limited number so please book your “Live Class + Recording” ticket OR your “Recording-Only“ ticket via the ticket link above as soon as you can to secure your place and avoid Matisse FOMO! Please read on for event description, materials list and booking info. If you need help with anything please email us at londondrawinggroup@gmail.com
Where: ONLINE!
Book here:
https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/.../henri-matisse-online...
Time: London, UK
If you cannot make the live event we send a recording out to everyone that books shortly after the live session so you can watch it once within 3 days, any time of day:)
This class is suitable for ALL LEVELS!
(We've had children as young as 4 join in, someone who is 97 and all ages in-between!)
You can use this site to convert UK time to where you are: https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/converter.html
EVENT DESCRIPTION:
"What I dream of is an art of balance, of purity and serenity devoid of troubling or depressing subject matter - a soothing, calming influence on the mind, rather like a good armchair which provides relaxation from physical fatigue." - Henri Matisse
This is an online art class where tutor Frances Stanfield will guide you through Matisse's playful approach to art making.
Matisse is best known for both his delightfully fluid drawing style and exquisite use of colour, particularly in his simplistic cut out works. You will be engaged in mimicking Matisse’s expressive and restlessly experimental way of working to inspire you in your own creative endeavours.
In this class we will be making our cut outs from a series of images which Frances will be presenting to you and from still life.
This class is suitable for ALL LEVELS
Everyone is welcome to join in on this Pay What You Can class… we know this is a difficult and uncertain time for many and we want to do our best to support you - As you are all probably aware, for the three of us at LDG creativity is our life-blood and our only source of income. Please be honest and pay what you can afford and our online classes will be able to run on a donations basis - if you are struggling, consider this one on the house! You just need to email us stating your situation at londondrawinggroup@gmail.com and we'll make it happen for you.
You will need:
*Some Scissors!
*Paper - you can use colour paper or you can paint/colour in paper prior to the class - Matisse painted his paper with Gouche if you want to really get your Matisse game on!
You can also use magazine pages, newspaper, wrapping paper, foil-anything you can cut easily!
*A collection of organic matter such as leaves and flowers (fresh or dried)
*Optional, but handy: pins and a piece of cardboard as big as your paper
AND/OR Bluetak, Masking Tape/Sticky Tape
IF YOU HAVE BOUGHT A LIVE CLASS TICKET WE HAVE SET UP AN EMAIL WITH THE ZOOM LINK TO ARRIVE IN YOUR INBOX 1 DAY BEFORE AND AGAIN ON THE DAY OF THE CLASS.
IF YOU HAVE BOUGHT A RECORDING ONLY TICKET WE WILL SEND YOU MORE INFO A DAY BEFORE THE LIVE CLASS AND THE RECORDING LINK AN HOUR AFTER THE LIVE CLASS FINISHES.
YOU CAN WATCH THE RECORDING ONCE WITHIN 3 DAYS.
If you need help with anything please EMAIL us through eventbrite or directly at londondrawinggroup@gmail.com - facebook and instagram messages are easily lost.
And that's it! We're really looking forward to you joining us.
Love,
LDG
PLEASE DO NOT CLICK ON LINKS THAT ARE NOT POSTED BY US - THESE ARE SCAM. Our tickets are sold safely on a pay-what-you-can basis through eventbrite. This can be found on the event ticket link at the top of this page. We're really sorry about any spam comments and links that may appear on this page - we are trying our best to keep on top of them but facebook are slow to respond so we are asking our friends and anyone that can help to report these kinds of posts when and if you see them. We really don't want to disable comments as they are so important for sharing the work made during the class and for our sense of connection and community.
And that's it! We're really looking forward to you joining us.
Love,
LDG

title: Blabla Language Exchange - Milan (Online)

description:
HOW OUR EVENTS WORK

It's very easy.
We always start our events in
English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in
French
.
...........................................................................
If the BlaBla Language Exchange team that manages events in your city does not want to work with language groups (this is often the case for large events), you will have to find people who will want to communicate with you in the language targeted. Don't worry, our
organizers can be your guides and can introduce you to people who want to speak the same language as you.
Do you like the concept?
So join us for new BlaBla Language Exchange adventures

___________________________________

hosts:

Comitato PARI Opportunità Trento
Lawyer & Law Firm
title: Il covid-19 non ferma la violenza: emergenza nelle emergenze
time: DEC 5 AT 4:30 PM UTC+01 – 6:30 PM UTC+01
description:
il COMITATO PARI OPPORTUNITÀ DEGLI AVVOCATI DI TRENTO, in occasione della giornata internazionale per l’eliminazione della violenza contro le donne

organizza un confronto multidisciplinare in pillole
mercoledì 2 dicembre ore 16.30-18.30
ONLINE
L’evento è accreditato dall’Ordine degli Avvocati di Trento,
dà diritto a due crediti deontologici.
ISCRIZIONI: per avvocate/i e praticanti su Formasfera
per esterni al link: https://bit.ly/36EVzmC
ENTRO IL 28 NOVEMBRE
Segue programma.

title: SFIDE MRS SPORTY
time: DEC 5 AT 1 PM UTC+01 – 8:30 PM UTC+01
description:
Diamo il via alle sfide Mrs Sporty!

Un'opportunità divertente che ti darà la possibilità di vincere fantastici premi Mrs Sporty
I PREMI che verranno messi in palio sono:
PER LE NOSTRE ISCRITTE
- 1h di personal trainer
- 5 ingressi gratuiti (per un’amica)
- Gadget (maglietta + borraccia Mrs Sporty)
- Gadget (zaino + asciugamano Mrs Sporty)

NON/EX ISCRITTE
- Primo mese a soli 29,99 euro*
- Sconto del 50% sulla start-up (al momento dell’iscrizione)
- 5 ingressi gratuiti per sé o per un’amica
- 1 mese gratuito dell’allenamento Online Base
*se si sottoscrive un abbonamento della durata minima di 6 mesi

Qui sotto troverete il REGOLAMENTO completo per svolgere queste sfide:

Verranno pubblicate sulla nostra pagina Facebook e Instagram due sfide al mese (giorno di pubblicazione: mercoledì).

La sfida consiste in un esercizio fisico da svolgere per il maggior numero di volte durante i 30 secondi. Chi eseguirà il maggior numero di ripetizioni vincerà un premio Mrs Sporty.

Per partecipare bisogna registrare un piccolo video di 30” riprendendosi mentre si esegue l’esercizio, che sarà poi da inviare alla pagina mrssportytrentobuonarroti tramite i sistemi di messaggistica di Facebook e/o Instagram.

Vengono accettati i video inviati entro le ore 20.00 del martedì della settimana seguente alla sfida.

Se sarai la vincitrice potrai scegliere tra uno dei nostri premi.
ATTENZIONE: ogni premio si può vincere una sola volta! Se vincerai più volte dovrai scegliere fra i premi che hai precedentemente scartato.

Se sarai la vincitrice ti verrà inviato per mail un coupon da utilizzare online già dal lunedì della settimana successiva alla vincita, oppure alla riapertura (non oltre i 4 mesi da questa data).

Se acconsentirai, ripubblicheremo nelle stories il tuo video taggandoti!
Mi raccomando, non perdere questa opportunità

hosts:
Host
Centro Sociale Bruno
Organization
title: Emiliano Merlin - Crisi Climatica e Zootecnia
time: THURSDAY AT 6:30 PM UTC+01 – 8:30 PM UTC+01
description:
WEBINAR
CRISI CLIMATICA E ZOOTECNIA
dott. Emiliano Merlin
L'attivismo per la giustizia climatica è compatibile col consumo dei derivati dello sfruttamento animale? Dal momento che il sistema del cosiddetto "allevamento intensivo" trova l'opposizione della maggior parte delle persone, è realistica una transizione collettiva verso le "piccole fattorie a gestione familiare" e l'allevamento estensivo?
Nel bel mezzo di una crisi sanitaria globale e in un pianeta che il sistema capitalista ha ormai portato sull’orlo del collasso ambientale, sentiamo l’urgenza di iniziare ad interrogarci rispetto alla “questione animale”. Per formarci rispetto all’impatto che l’allevamento di miliardi di animali non umani ha sull’emissione (diretta ed indiretta) di gas serra ed in termini di consumo di acqua, suolo e risorse naturali invitiamo tutt* a seguire l’intervento di Emiliano Merlin, dal titolo “Crisi climatica e zootecnia”.
Emiliano Merlin è dottore di ricerca in Astronomia e ricercatore all'Istituto Nazionale di Astrofisica. Si occupa anche di cambiamento climatico e della sua connessione con la zootecnia, e ha tenuto seminari per Climate Save Movement, Essere Animali e altre associazioni, in eventi pubblici e nelle scuole secondarie.

hosts:
Host
Edizioni Centro Studi Erickson
Publisher
title: Storia: verifiche inclusive e personalizzate
time: DEC 4 AT 5 PM UTC+01 – 6 PM UTC+01
description:
"Storia: verifiche inclusive e personalizzate per la scuola secondaria di I grado", webinar gratuito con Davide Apolloni e Nicoletta Manfrin
Iscriviti qui
https://bit.ly/2UTFjZB
Preparare verifiche diversificate di storia adatte a stili di apprendimento diversi non è un compito facile, in particolare se il nostro intento non si limita alla sola valutazione degli apprendimenti. In questo webinar affrontiamo quindi l'argomento della realizzazione e dell'adattamento delle verifiche di storia per tutti gli alunni, compresi DSA, BES o con legge 104.
Generalmente, nei manuali scolastici sono disponibili ottimi materiali per l'analisi dei documenti, per svolgere attività in aula o a casa, a gruppi o a coppie, ma non sempre sono presenti indicazioni su come costruire una verifica in base alle esigenze di ciascun insegnante e alunno.
Partendo dai materiali del libro Verifiche personalizzate - Storia, Scuola Secondaria di I Grado, spiegheremo quali sono i criteri per la creazione di verifiche diversificate e inclusive da proporre alle varie tipologie di alunni. Interverranno:
Nicoletta Manfrin, Laureata in Lettere con indirizzo storico-artistico. Si è specializzata in Storia dell’Arte Moderna e si è occupata della creazione e della gestione di laboratori didattici di storia presso alcuni Musei del Veneto. Insegna Italiano, Storia e Geografia nella scuola secondaria di primo grado. Per le edizioni Erickson ha realizzato materiali e strumenti per insegnanti ed alunni all’interno di manuali di storia, di geografia e di storia dell’arte per la scuola secondaria di I grado.
Davide Apolloni, laureato in Lettere, con indirizzo storico-artistico, presso l’Università degli Studi di Padova. Ha una Specializzazione in Storia dell’Arte e delle Arti Minori. Insegna Italiano, Storia e Geografia nella scuola secondaria di primo grado e Storia dell’Arte per l’Università degli Adulti di Vicenza. È collaboratore Erickson per la realizzazione di manuali di storia, di geografia e di storia dell’arte e guide per docenti per la scuola secondaria di I grado.
